result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley James Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: concurrent with count 2 
**12-09-16 with credit for 35 days time served.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 35 days.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by the end of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by the end of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution is set at zero.
Complete high school or obtain equivalency diploma.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause (as to probation).
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with C.S. (DOB 12/19/00). Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction on count 2 only, following the successful completion of probation.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley James Bauer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: As to the order signed 12-09-16 amended to include 35 days of sentence credit on count one.
Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, calendar successor, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit on count one.

Certification of PLEA & SENTENCING transcript commencing SEPTEMBER 18, 2015 received and filed. (60 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to REQUIRED BY STATUTE. kl
Count 2 only.

Defendant Bradley James Bauer in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense.  
AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 2 with credit for zero days time served.  IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1.5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 35 days. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
 (as to probation)
-Complete high school or obtain equivalency diploma.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with C.S. (DOB 12/19/00). Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by the end of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by the end of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
-Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction on count 2 only, following the successful completion of probation.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, and changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Case passed for sentencing, as ADA Schindhelm is in trial in another court.

Defendant Bradley James Bauer in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED INFORMATION.
As to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to exposing genitals, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.10(1) and (1)(b), a class A MISDEMEANOR. 
As to Count 2:  the court amended the charge to bail jumping (felony), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), a class H FELONY.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Bradley James Bauer not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 9/18/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with drug testing, absolute sobriety, no use or possession of controlled substances, no firearms/dangerous weapons.

Defendant Bradley James Bauer in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 9/3/2015  at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 8/12/2015.
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is calendared for RETURN on WARRANT  on 8/20/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15.
Notice is given to defense counsel and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Bradley James Bauer not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a plea date is granted by the court.  Defendant is in custody at Childrens Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-06-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Bradley James Bauer in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody.  Ronald Dague for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
April 29, 2015 @ 8:30A in Prelim Court, CJF Rm 146 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
Produce and return juvenile, Bradley Bauer, to Criminal Justice Facility for hearing on 04/29/2015; faxed and filed.  bes

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court.  Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody, not in court.  Randy Sitzberger for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced timely form Children's Court Detention Center.  State did have officer present, however, officer is not able to return to court this p.m.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with CES ( 12/19/2000).

Defendant Bradley James Bauer in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  
Defendant Bradley James Bauer in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained  from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant  he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

 Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
